      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void adjacencyCheck(java.awt.Point p, int[] points, int capturer)
      runs recursively, checking all adjacent squares and if the squares are both captured and not in captureList then adjacencyCheck is run recursively on the new square.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        runs the game, reading in the board, scoring the players and printing the result

      • readBoard

        public static boolean readBoard()
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                java.io.IOException
        reads in the board to a 2d array and populates a list of captured squares to captureList. Also sets a flag for if the board is in a final state.
        Returns:
        the flag gameFinished which determines if board is in a fnal state
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.io.IOException

      • checkWinner

        public static java.lang.String checkWinner(boolean gameOver,
                           int[] points)
        checks for the winner of the game, returning strings None, Draw, Black or White.
        Parameters:
        gameOver - if the board is in a final state (if false returns None)
        points - an array that contains the scores for each player
        Returns:
        A string corresponding the winner of the game

      • getPlayerFromChar

        public static int getPlayerFromChar(char player)
        takes in a char value ('B' or 'W') and converts them to an integer values, 0 for black and 1 for white
        Parameters:
        player - a char that is either 'B' or 'W'
        Returns:
        the index of the player (determined by the char player) in scores[]

      • adjacencyCheck

        public static void adjacencyCheck(java.awt.Point p,
                  int[] points,
                  int capturer)
        runs recursively, checking all adjacent squares and if the squares are both captured and not in captureList then adjacencyCheck is run recursively on the new square.
        Parameters:
        p - contains the coordinates of a captured square
        points - a scoreboard for the players, [0] for black and [1] for white
        capturer - the index of the points array corresponding the capturing player
